title: The Weeknd and Anitta Release Video for New Song “São Paulo”: Watch

html:
Freeka Tet directed the bizarre Hurry Up Tomorrow visual

During a special concert in São Paulo, Brazil, in September, the Weeknd and Brazilian pop star Anitta debuted a new song called “São Paulo.” It’s now been officially released, along with a video directed by Freeka Tet. In the visual, Anitta is masked and pregnant, and her belly is more than a bit unusual. Find the video below.

“São Paulo”—produced byMike Dean, Sean Solymar, and the Weeknd—is the third preview of the Weeknd’s Hurry Up Tomorrow, following “Dancing in the Flames” and the Playboi Carti collaboration “Timeless.” The Canadian singer’s follow-up to Dawn FM does not currently have a release date.

Earlier this year, Anitta released Funk Generation. She also toured North America properly for the first time.

Matthew Strauss is a Long Island native and a graduate of Columbia University. He joined Pitchfork in 2013.
